verses.text: And when \w Balaam|strong="H1109"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that it \w pleased|strong="H5869"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to \w bless|strong="H1288"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, he \w went|strong="H1980"\w* not, as at other \w times|strong="H6471"\w*, to \w seek|strong="H7125"\w* for \w enchantments|strong="H5173"\w*, but he \w set|strong="H7896"\w* his \w face|strong="H6440"\w* toward the \w wilderness|strong="H4057"\w*.\f + \fr 24.1 \ft to seek…: Heb. to the meeting of\f*

And \w Balaam|strong="H1109"\w* lifted \w up|strong="H5375"\w* his \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*, and he \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* \w abiding|strong="H7931"\w* \add in his tents\add* according to their \w tribes|strong="H7626"\w*; and the \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w* came upon him.

And he took \w up|strong="H5375"\w* his \w parable|strong="H4912"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Balaam|strong="H1109"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Beor|strong="H1160"\w* hath \w said|strong="H5002"\w*, and the \w man|strong="H1397"\w* whose \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* are \w open|strong="H8365"\w* hath \w said|strong="H5002"\w*:\f + \fr 24.3 \ft whose…: Heb. who had his eyes shut, but now opened\f*

He hath \w said|strong="H5002"\w*, which \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* the \w words|strong="H0561"\w* of \w God|strong="H0410"\w*, which \w saw|strong="H2372"\w* the \w vision|strong="H4236"\w* of the \w Almighty|strong="H7706"\w*, \w falling|strong="H5307"\w* \add into a trance\add*, but having his \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* \w open|strong="H1540"\w*:
How \w goodly|strong="H2895"\w* are thy \w tents|strong="H0168"\w*, O \w Jacob|strong="H3290"\w*, \add and\add* thy \w tabernacles|strong="H4908"\w*, O \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*!

As the \w valleys|strong="H5158"\w* are they spread \w forth|strong="H5186"\w*, as \w gardens|strong="H1593"\w* by the \w river’s side|strong="H5104"\w*, as the trees of lign \w aloes|strong="H0174"\w* which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath \w planted|strong="H5193"\w*, \add and\add* as cedar \w trees|strong="H0730"\w* beside the \w waters|strong="H4325"\w*.

He shall \w pour|strong="H5140"\w* the \w water|strong="H4325"\w* \w out|strong="H5140"\w* of his \w buckets|strong="H1805"\w*, and his \w seed|strong="H2233"\w* \add shall be\add* in \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w*, and his \w king|strong="H4428"\w* shall be \w higher|strong="H7311"\w* than \w Agag|strong="H0090"\w*, and his \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w* shall be \w exalted|strong="H5375"\w*.

\w God|strong="H0410"\w* brought him \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* out of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*; he hath as it were the \w strength|strong="H8443"\w* of an \w unicorn|strong="H7214"\w*: he shall eat \w up|strong="H0398"\w* the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* his \w enemies|strong="H6862"\w*, and shall \w break|strong="H1633"\w* their \w bones|strong="H6106"\w*, and \w pierce|strong="H4272"\w* \add them\add* through with his \w arrows|strong="H2671"\w*.

He \w couched|strong="H3766"\w*, he lay \w down|strong="H7901"\w* as a \w lion|strong="H0738"\w*, and as a great \w lion|strong="H3833"\w*: who shall stir him \w up|strong="H6965"\w*? \w Blessed|strong="H1288"\w* \add is\add* he that \w blesseth|strong="H1288"\w* thee, and \w cursed|strong="H0779"\w* \add is\add* he that \w curseth|strong="H0779"\w* thee.

¶ And \w Balak’s|strong="H1111"\w* \w anger|strong="H0639"\w* was \w kindled|strong="H2734"\w* against \w Balaam|strong="H1109"\w*, and he \w smote|strong="H5606"\w* his \w hands|strong="H3709"\w* \w together|strong="H5606"\w*: and \w Balak|strong="H1111"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Balaam|strong="H1109"\w*, I \w called|strong="H7121"\w* thee to \w curse|strong="H6895"\w* mine \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*, and, behold, thou hast \w altogether|strong="H1288"\w* \w blessed|strong="H1288"\w* \add them\add* these \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w times|strong="H6471"\w*.

Therefore now \w flee|strong="H1272"\w* thou to thy \w place|strong="H4725"\w*: I \w thought|strong="H0559"\w* to \w promote|strong="H3513"\w* thee unto \w great|strong="H3513"\w* \w honour|strong="H3513"\w*; but, lo, the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath kept thee \w back|strong="H4513"\w* from \w honour|strong="H3519"\w*.

And \w Balaam|strong="H1109"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Balak|strong="H1111"\w*, \w Spake|strong="H1696"\w* I not also to thy \w messengers|strong="H4397"\w* which thou \w sentest|strong="H7971"\w* unto me, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*,

If \w Balak|strong="H1111"\w* would \w give|strong="H5414"\w* me his \w house|strong="H1004"\w* \w full|strong="H4393"\w* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* and \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*, I \w cannot|strong="H3201"\w* go \w beyond|strong="H5674"\w* the \w commandment|strong="H6310"\w* of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \add either\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* or \w bad|strong="H7451"\w* of mine own \w mind|strong="H3820"\w*; \add but\add* what the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \w saith|strong="H1696"\w*, that will I \w speak|strong="H1696"\w*?

And now, behold, I \w go|strong="H1980"\w* unto my \w people|strong="H5971"\w*: \w come|strong="H3212"\w* \add therefore, and\add* I will \w advertise|strong="H3289"\w* thee what this \w people|strong="H5971"\w* shall \w do|strong="H6213"\w* to thy \w people|strong="H5971"\w* in the \w latter|strong="H0319"\w* \w days|strong="H3117"\w*.

¶ And he took \w up|strong="H5375"\w* his \w parable|strong="H4912"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Balaam|strong="H1109"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Beor|strong="H1160"\w* hath \w said|strong="H5002"\w*, and the \w man|strong="H1397"\w* whose \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* are \w open|strong="H8365"\w* hath \w said|strong="H5002"\w*:

He hath \w said|strong="H5002"\w*, which \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* the \w words|strong="H0561"\w* of \w God|strong="H0410"\w*, and \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* the \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w* of the most \w High|strong="H5945"\w*, \add which\add* \w saw|strong="H2372"\w* the \w vision|strong="H4236"\w* of the \w Almighty|strong="H7706"\w*, \w falling|strong="H5307"\w* \add into a trance\add*, but having his \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* \w open|strong="H1540"\w*:

I shall \w see|strong="H7200"\w* him, but not now: I shall \w behold|strong="H7789"\w* him, but not \w nigh|strong="H7138"\w*: there shall \w come|strong="H1869"\w* a \w Star|strong="H3556"\w* out of \w Jacob|strong="H3290"\w*, and a \w Sceptre|strong="H7626"\w* shall \w rise|strong="H6965"\w* out of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and shall \w smite|strong="H4272"\w* the \w corners|strong="H6285"\w* of \w Moab|strong="H4124"\w*, and \w destroy|strong="H6979"\w* all the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Sheth|strong="H8352"\w*.\f + \fr 24.17 \ft smite…: or, smite through the princes of\f*

And \w Edom|strong="H0123"\w* shall be a \w possession|strong="H3424"\w*, \w Seir|strong="H8165"\w* also shall be a \w possession|strong="H3424"\w* for his \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*; and \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* shall \w do|strong="H6213"\w* \w valiantly|strong="H2428"\w*.

Out of \w Jacob|strong="H3290"\w* shall come he that shall have \w dominion|strong="H7287"\w*, and shall \w destroy|strong="H0006"\w* him that \w remaineth|strong="H8300"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.

¶ And when he \w looked|strong="H7200"\w* on \w Amalek|strong="H6002"\w*, he took \w up|strong="H5375"\w* his \w parable|strong="H4912"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Amalek|strong="H6002"\w* \add was\add* the \w first|strong="H7225"\w* of the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w*; but his \w latter|strong="H0319"\w* end \add shall be\add* that he \w perish|strong="H0008"\w* for \w ever|strong="H5703"\w*.\f + \fr 24.20 \ft the nations: the nations that warred against Israel\f*\f + \fr 24.20 \ft that…: or, even to destruction\f*

And he \w looked|strong="H7200"\w* on the \w Kenites|strong="H7017"\w*, and took \w up|strong="H5375"\w* his \w parable|strong="H4912"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Strong|strong="H0386"\w* is thy \w dwellingplace|strong="H4186"\w*, and thou \w puttest|strong="H7760"\w* thy \w nest|strong="H7064"\w* in a \w rock|strong="H5553"\w*.

Nevertheless the \w Kenite|strong="H7014"\w* \w shall|strong="H0518"\w* be \w wasted|strong="H1197"\w*, until \w Asshur|strong="H0804"\w* shall carry thee away \w captive|strong="H7617"\w*.\f + \fr 24.22 \ft the Kenite: Heb. Kain\f*\f + \fr 24.22 \ft until…: or, how long shall it be ere Asshur carry thee away captive\f*

And he took \w up|strong="H5375"\w* his \w parable|strong="H4912"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Alas|strong="H0188"\w*, who shall \w live|strong="H2421"\w* when \w God|strong="H0410"\w* \w doeth|strong="H7760"\w* this!

And \w ships|strong="H6716"\w* \add shall come\add* from the \w coast|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Chittim|strong="H3794"\w*, and shall \w afflict|strong="H6031"\w* \w Asshur|strong="H0804"\w*, and shall \w afflict|strong="H6031"\w* \w Eber|strong="H5677"\w*, and he also shall \w perish|strong="H0008"\w* for \w ever|strong="H5703"\w*.

And \w Balaam|strong="H1109"\w* rose \w up|strong="H6965"\w*, and \w went|strong="H3212"\w* and \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* to his \w place|strong="H4725"\w*: and \w Balak|strong="H1111"\w* also \w went|strong="H1980"\w* his \w way|strong="H1870"\w*.
